DCL Public API: Date and Time

Send comments on this topic.
This module contains routines for encoding and decoding date/time values.

Summary

DclDateTimeDecode   Decode a date/time value to the individual parts -- year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond, and microsecond.
DclDateTimeEncode   Encode a date/time value from the individual parts -- year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond, and microsecond.
DclDateTimeString   Convert a date/time to a human readable string.
DclTimeFormat   Convert a count of relative seconds and formats it as a string.
DclTimeFormatUS   Take a count of relative microseconds, round it to the nearest millisecond, and format it as a string.

DclDateTimeDecode

D_BOOL DclDateTimeDecode(
    const D_TIME *pTime,
    DCLDATETIME *pDateTime)
Decode a date/time value to the individual parts -- year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond, and microsecond.

Parameters

pTime - A pointer to the raw date/time value
pDateTime - A buffer to receive the decoded date/time

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclDateTimeEncode

D_BOOL DclDateTimeEncode(
    const DCLDATETIME *pDateTime,
    D_TIME *pTime)
Encode a date/time value from the individual parts -- year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond, and microsecond.

Parameters

pDateTime - A pointer to the date/time in component form
pTime - A buffer to receive the encoded date/time

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclDateTimeString

D_BOOL DclDateTimeString(
    const D_TIME *pTime,
    char *pBuffer,
    size_t nBuffLen)
Convert a date/time to a human readable string.

The output is in the following format 

        Jul 05 13:08:27 2003

If the pTime parameter is NULL, the current date/time is used.

Parameters

pTime - A pointer to the raw date/time value
pBuffer - A buffer to receive the formatted string
nBuffLen - The size of the buffer

Return Value

Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

DclTimeFormat

char * DclTimeFormat(
    D_UINT64 ullSeconds,
    char *pBuffer,
    size_t nBuffLen)
Convert a count of relative seconds and formats it as a string.

The output is in the form -- "days

hh:mm:ss".

"days" is a variable length field, and will be "0" if the count represents less than one day. The other fields will always be two characters long.

Parameters

ullSeconds - The count of seconds to use
pBuffer - A buffer to receive the formatted string
nBuffLen - The size of the buffer

Return Value

Returns a pointer to the output buffer if successful, or NULL if the output buffer is not long enough (in which case it may have been modified).

DclTimeFormatUS

char * DclTimeFormatUS(
    D_UINT64 ullMicrosecs,
    char *pBuffer,
    size_t nBuffLen)
Take a count of relative microseconds, round it to the nearest millisecond, and format it as a string.

The output is in the form -- "days

hh:mm:ss.mmm".

"days" is a variable length field, and will be "0" if the count represents less than one day. The mm, hh, and ss fields will always be two characters long. The mmm milliseconds field will always be 3 character long.

Parameters

ullMicrosecs - The count of microseconds to use
pBuffer - A buffer to receive the formatted string
nBuffLen - The size of the buffer

Return Value

Returns a pointer to the output buffer if successful, or NULL if the output buffer is not long enough (in which case it may have been modified).
